meaningMnemonic: To stay <kanji>alive</kanji> in some <kanji>climate</kanji>s, some have no choice but to be a <vocabulary>freeloader</vocabulary>. That is, <vocabulary>a lodger who pays nothing</vocabulary>. If you live somewhere with an inhospitable climate but you can't afford to pay rent, your only option is to live with someone for free.
readingMnemonic:
This is a slightly unusual case because both kanji use the kun'yomi. You haven't learned that reading for 候 yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

What? You've become a <vocabulary>freeloader</vocabulary>? I can't believe you've gone <reading>so low</reading> (そうろう)!
